definition: A proposed explanation based on limited evidence, to be tested.
A well-substantiated explanation of some aspect of the natural world.
A scientific procedure to test a hypothesis.
Any factor, trait, or condition that can exist in differing amounts or types.
Facts and statistics collected for analysis.
Information used to support or refute a claim or hypothesis.
The smallest unit of an element, made up of protons, neutrons, and electrons.
Two or more atoms bonded together.
The ability to do work or cause change.
A push or pull acting upon an object.
The force that attracts two bodies toward each other.
A measure of the amount of matter in an object.
The rate of change of velocity per unit of time.
The basic structural and functional unit of all living organisms.
The molecule that carries genetic information in living organisms.
The process by which species change over time through natural selection.
The process by which green plants use sunlight to make food.
A community of living organisms and their environment.
A process in which substances change into new substances.
The emission of energy as electromagnetic waves or particles.
